title: Memoirs of the Life of Sir Walter Scott, Volume 6
author: Lockhart, J. G. (John Gibson)
snippet: It is high to hear these young fellows talk of the Raid     of Airdrie, the trot of Kilmarnock, and so on, like so many     moss-troopers.

title: The Sunday Philosophy Club
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: He would do it for a year, and then back to crime in some place like Airdrie or Bathgate.

title: The Right Attitude to Rain
author: McCall Smith, Alexander

title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: Have you ever been to Airdrie, David?'

title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: Once in Airdrie and twice in Ayrshire.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr. Alexander Carlyle, Minister of Inveresk,
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: About the end of April, my sister, and my wife, and [I, paid] a visit to our friends in Glasgow, where we were most cordially received by my old friends, Mr Dreghorn and sundry other merchants, who were connected with Mr Bell in Airdrie, particularly Eobin Boyle and the Dunlops.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr Alexander Carlyle ;
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: About the end of April, my sister, and my wife, and [I, paid] a visit to our friends in Glasgow, where we were most cordially received by my old friends, Mr Dreghorn and sundry other merchants, who were connected with Mr Bell in Airdrie, particularly Robin Boyle and the Dunlops.
